intro: Lellingeria saffordii, commonly known as the Safford's lellingeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance.
